com.googlecode.jaks.examples

Class SVNFixup

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.jaks.cli.AbstractCommand
      • com.googlecode.jaks.examples.SVNFixup

  • public class SVNFixup
extends AbstractCommand
    When run against one or more Subversion-managed folders, corrects the svn:mime-type property for web-ish (html, jpeg, css, etc.) and Maven-repo-ish (md5, pom, jar, etc.) files so that they can be served directly out of Subversion. This is a good demonstration of running child processes with Subprocess (the calls to Subversion), basic XML manipulations with XmlUtil, and file enumeration with FileUtil and Filter.
    Author:
    Jason Smith

      • fixupMimetype

        protected void fixupMimetype(File file)
                      throws SubprocessException,
                             Exception
        Inspect the file and correct the mimetype as necessary. This covers various image, text, and binary formats I need to serve content through GoogleCode's Subversion.
        Parameters:
        file - The target file.
        Throws:
        SubprocessException - See SubprocessException.
        Exception - See Exception.

      • svnInfo

        protected Document svnInfo(File file)
                    throws SubprocessException,
                           Exception
        Gets the Subversion info for a file or folder as an XML document. If the file is not being managed by Subversion, throws an exception. Document is generated by svn info --xml.
        Parameters:
        file - The target file or folder.
        Returns:
        The info document.
        Throws:
        SubprocessException - See Subprocess.call(java.io.OutputStream, java.io.OutputStream).
        Exception - See Exception.
